intro: Cyrtandra heteronema, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra heteronema plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
